articles.title: About this site
articles.description:
Welcome to my site, and thanks for checking it out. The content here represents the culmination of my professional
career and related personal projects thus far. I update it regularly with my current endeavors. Enjoy!

articles.title: Bio
articles.contents: I’m currently pursuing a masters degree in Environmental Data Science at UC Santa Barbara’s Bren School of Environmental Science and Management. I spent my undergraduate career studying ecology at the University of North Carolina at Asheville. I entered the realm of environmental research as a technician with the US Forest Service, conducting field work for several studies concerning eastern hemlock decline. Following this path, I pursued my own undergraduate research looking at the habitat preferences of two orchid species in Western North Carolina, and spent another field season collecting and analyzing data for a forest gap and regeneration study with NC State University. Wanting to try my hand at education and to get more involved in my community, I spent nearly three years as the Environmental Educator for a small nonprofit in Asheville. During this time I started teaching myself to code and was drawn to the idea of applying data science techniques to combat environmental issues. I hope to use the environmental data science degree I’m working towards to assess the use of emerging technologies in the fight against climate change.
